Mercury Cadmium Telluride.name: Mercury Cadmium Telluride
Mercury Cadmium Telluride.description: II-VI alloy for SWIR/MWIR/LWIR detectors via tunable bandgap (by Cd fraction 'x'). Requires cryogenic cooling. Preferred substrate: CdZnTe (~4% Zn).

safety.handling: Requires PPE, fume hood/glovebox, hazardous waste disposal.

identification.phase_diagram_notes: Pseudo-binary. Narrow liquidus-solidus. Critical Hg pressure control needed.

advanced_fabrication_insights.stoichiometry_control: Challenge: High Hg vapor pressure. Requires precise Temp/Hg pressure management (MBE, MOCVD, Annealing).
advanced_fabrication_insights.common_defects_impact: Hg vacancies (acceptors), Te precipitates (shunts), dislocations (mismatch). Impact lifetime, noise, yield.
advanced_fabrication_insights.surface_preparation: Critical pre-epitaxy step (cleaning, oxide removal) for interface quality.
advanced_fabrication_insights.method_specific_notes: LPE: Te-rich, simpler. MBE: Low temp, precise layers. MOCVD: Conformal, precursor challenges.

Mercury Cadmium Telluride.name: Mercury Cadmium Telluride
Mercury Cadmium Telluride.description: II-VI alloy semiconductor with bandgap tuned via Cadmium mole fraction (x). Key material for high-performance SWIR/MWIR/LWIR detectors, typically requiring cryogenic cooling. Preferred substrate: CdZnTe (~4% Zn).

safety.toxicity: High (Contains Hg, Cd). Follow strict safety protocols.
safety.handling: Requires PPE, fume hood/glovebox, hazardous waste disposal.

identification.phase_diagram_notes: Pseudo-binary. Narrow liquidus-solidus gap. Critical Hg partial pressure control needed.

advanced_fabrication_insights.stoichiometry_control: Challenge: High Hg vapor pressure. Requires precise Temp/Pressure control (MBE, MOCVD, Annealing).
advanced_fabrication_insights.common_defects_impact: Hg vacancies (acceptors, ↓lifetime), Te precipitates (shunts, noise), Dislocations (mismatch, ↓lifetime/noise).
advanced_fabrication_insights.surface_preparation: Critical for epitaxy (cleaning, oxide removal). Surface easily damaged.
advanced_fabrication_insights.method_specific_notes: LPE: Te-rich, simpler. MBE: Precise, lower temp, UHV. MOCVD: Conformal, precursor challenges.

growth_fabrication_properties.source_materials_purity: Elemental Hg, Cd, Te (>6N purity essential).
growth_fabrication_properties.preferred_substrates_orientations: Substrate: CdZnTe (~4% Zn); Si, GaAs, Ge (w/ buffers). Orientation: (111)B (LPE); (211)B, (100) (MBE/MOCVD).
growth_fabrication_properties.typical_growth_parameters: Method/x dependent. Rates: ~1-5 um/hr. Precise Temp/Pressure vital.
growth_fabrication_properties.passivation_methods: Essential. Common: ZnS, CdTe, SiO2 (Sputter, MBE, ALD).

post_growth_processing.annealing: CRITICAL. Purpose: Reduce Hg vacancies, activate p-dopants, improve crystal. Temps: ~200-450C. Requires Hg overpressure.
post_growth_processing.lapping_polishing: Lapping: Al2O3/SiC slurries. Polishing: Diamond (<1um) or CMP (Br-Methanol). Low pressure (brittle).
post_growth_processing.etching: Wet: Br-Methanol/EG mixes. Dry: RIE/ICP (CH4/H2, Ar, Halogens) for patterning.

device_integration_characterization.device_architectures: Photoconductors (PC), Photovoltaic Diodes (PV/PD). Mesa or planar.
device_integration_characterization.readout_integration: Flip-chip bonding to Si ROIC via Indium bumps (FPAs).
device_integration_characterization.ar_coatings: Needed (high n). Common: ZnS, Ge, dielectric stacks.
device_integration_characterization.packaging_cooling: Requires vacuum package & cryogenic cooling (e.g., Stirling, LN2) for low noise.

band_gap.notes: Tunable via x. LWIR x≈0.2, MWIR x≈0.3.

electrical_properties.common_dopants: n-type: In (mid 10^14+). p-type: As, Au, Hg-vacancies (mid 10^15+).

chemical_properties.stability_oxidation: Surface unstable; requires passivation; readily oxidizes.
chemical_properties.etching: Wet: Br-MeOH/EG. Dry: RIE/ICP (CH4/H2, Ar, Halogens).

comparison_alternatives.vs_InSb: HgCdTe: Wider tuning (LWIR+), higher T_op possible (MWIR). InSb: Cheaper, mature (MWIR).
comparison_alternatives.vs_QWIPs: HgCdTe: Higher QE & T_op. QWIPs: Better uniformity, lower cost potential (GaAs based).
comparison_alternatives.vs_T2SLs: T2SLs: Potential for higher T_op, lower dark current, lower Auger. Complex growth.

references_further_reading.review_hansen: Hansen, G. L., et al. (1982). J. Appl. Phys. 53, 7099 (Eg eqn.)
